Could you please provide more detail and/or reproducible scenario as to how you ran into this NPE?  Do you always see this null pointer exception every time you open an xml file?  Does the editor continue to open or not?  What type of file were you trying to open?  Did it have the xml extension?  It sounds like a duplicate of bug 177304.  If not, could you please attach a file that reproduces the problem?

Also, according to https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/page.cgi?id=fields.html#bug_severity
Critical: crashes, loss of data, severe memory leak
Major: major loss of function

Were you crashing, losing data, severely leaking memory?  If not, could you please lower the severity to Major?

Thanks.

I had the problem an a .wbk file with contains XML content. I had just after the bug a dialog window "Unsupported Content Type". The bug don't occur anymore with my .wbk files after associating .wbk to XML files.
Anyway, the bug still occur with regular XML files (.xml). Here is the content of one of it (web.xml):
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE web-app PUBLIC "-//Sun Microsystems, Inc.//DTD Web Application 2.3//EN" "http://java.sun.com/dtd/web-app_2_3.dtd">
<web-app>
  <display-name>Gateway</display-name>
  <servlet>
    <servlet-name>GatewayServlet</servlet-name>
    <servlet-class>com.gateway.GatewayServlet</servlet-class>
  </servlet>
  <servlet-mapping>
    <servlet-name>GatewayServlet</servlet-name>
    <url-pattern>/GatewayServlet</url-pattern>
  </servlet-mapping>
</web-app>
